Title: About composition of Holder functions.
AcceptedAnswer: In fact, $\alpha\beta$ is optimal. To prove it, let $f,g:[0,1]\to\mathbb{R}$ with $f(x)=x^\alpha$ and $g(x)=x^\beta$. Note that $f\circ g\in C^{\alpha\beta}$, however, for all $\gamma>\alpha\beta$, $f\circ g$ does not belong to $C^\gamma$.
